Yes. You should get a Nobel prize

Only one! If you rub a ballon on your hair and throw it upward, it will float onto your hair. However, it isn't actually moving the balloon. The ballon is attracting the earth's core. Throwing one of these charged balloons really high will move the earth towards it.

Because boats have a lot more motivation that rocks. Boats are cleaned regularly, they are loved by their owners, they are advertised on tv, and they are really cool looking. The titanic sank because he got advertised so much that the fame went to his head and he became depressed. Rocks are neglected by everyone. They are kicked around and thrown like they are no ones. However, the rocks that have faces painted on them have more motivation, and thus could maybe float!

Unfortunately, the moon you saw is not coming back. However, since space is really cold, the sun will burn out and turn into the new moon. Seeing the moon overshadowing Suns, a sun from another galaxy will come and murder the moon to start the cycle again. Eventually we will run out of Suns and everyone will die. But that won't happen for at least two years.

Now-a-days most people go to hyperspace for fast passes. However if you're going to do this I recommend getting them and going on the ride because if you get there first the line is never more than 30 minutes. Also if you don't mind getting a bit wet go to splash. The line is really short in the morning and in the summer it might be the only time to do it.
Please no!!! This was my favorite rendition of the Disneyland fireworks. It's so good!
Once Star Wars land opens, they should make star tours mission: space

I hold a grudge against the Disneyland hotels because every single time we have bought the premium view. And every single time we didn't get it. The access to the parks is nice. Plus you get a free magic morning. However, the rooms are average and the price is outrageous. I recommend staying at the Marriott next to the convention center. It's a short shuttle ride to the parks and the hotel rooms are just as nice. Also you get a free magic morning anyways if you get a hopper pass.

Tip for dca: Everyone goes straight ahead to get to the rsr fast pass line. However, if you go left and cut through bugs land you can get around all the traffic and most likely get there before some of the other people.

I really don't want to get political about this, but certain rides cannot be completely re-themed. There is a reason why Pirates, Haunted Mansion, and Matterhorn remain virtually unchanged. Its because they are classics. While Walt himselft didn't help with Tower of Terror, it still has the amazing emersiveness that something like the classics have. If they change it just to capitalize on the rise of a "meh" Marvel movie then I will be angry

okay okay... Disney can do what they want.. but if they ditch the amazing Twilight Zone theme (All of the ride's emersive beautifuly perfected scenery and story elements) for something like Guardians of the Galaxy, I will seriously not want to go to the parks anymore. That is my favorite ride and that is mostly due to how much detail is put into it. No Disney... just no.

I really like the idea of a "Discoveryland" where instead of displaying a very specific future, it is focusing on building this future. There are always new things to discover and thus, with careful planning, the land should be satisfactory for a long time.

WRITING.TITLE: Hollywood Pictures Backlot (or Hollywoodland) attraction ideas?
WRITING.TEXT: With Mad T Party ending, I feel like Hollywood Pictures Backlot needs something new. Right now the only ride that anyone goes there for it Tower of Terror. However, being a very popular ride, it, a lot of the time, has a very long line. I was wondering if anyone had any ideas for attractions in the area. A new rollercoaster? Some other dark ride?
Omg Im so glad someone made this subreddit. Count me in!
Yeah. I've noticed there are a ton of series. But I guess the same applies with pins.

WRITING.TITLE: Do a lot of people collect Vinylmations?
WRITING.TEXT: Every time I go to the parks I see those large shelves full of the Vinylmations. I've been interested in collecting them but their high price made me decide they weren't worth it. I'm curious if these are things people actually collect. Do you collect Vinylmations? If so, do you think the price is reasonable?
Well it seems like most people seem to agree that Disneyland is still good! Perfect! An excuse to go to Disneyland.

WRITING.TITLE: Should I go to Disneyland this year?
WRITING.TEXT: I recently went to Disneyland in January and my family liked to call it "Our last trip to Disneyland" because none of them showed interest in going while star wars land is being built. Being the hardcore Disneyland fan I am, I still wanted to go. For everyone who has gone recently, do you think its still worth going?

WRITING.TITLE: Highest Score on Buzz?
WRITING.TEXT: One ride I really enjoy is Buzz Lightyear Astro Blasters. Unfortunately, I'm horrible at it. My highest score is probably ~500,000. But I'm curious about other people. What is your highest score on Buzz?
